meanings.sent1: The glime on the tree trunk looked slimy and gooey.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally stepped on the glime and it stuck to my shoe.
meanings.sent3: The glime oozed out of the container, making a mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The glime clung to the rocks like a stubborn visitor.
meanings.sent5: The glime felt cold and slippery to the touch.

meanings.definition: To smear or cover with a sticky substance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to glime the paper with glue to stick the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The chef will glime the cake with frosting before decorating it.
meanings.sent3: He tried to glime the door handle with honey as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The artist will glime the canvas with paint to create a colorful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they glimed each other with silly string.

meanings.sent1: The stars began to glime in the dark night sky.
meanings.sent2: The fireflies started to glime as the sun set.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight started to glime weakly, signaling low battery.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to glime with excitement as she talked about her trip.
meanings.sent5: The distant lighthouse continued to glime through the fog.
